snippet: If, as expected, the engineered corn gets a go-ahead for cultivation, genetic modification will remain a sensitive issue for Europe and the United States during trade talks.
abstract: European Union is on verge of approving insect-resistant type of engineered corn for cultivation, despite opposition from many member countries; opponents of genetically modified crops fail to muster sufficient support to block authorization under EU's complex weighted voting system; even if corn gets go-ahead for cultivation, it will remain a sensitive issue for Europe and the United States during trade talks.
lead_paragraph: If, as expected, the engineered corn gets a go-ahead for cultivation, genetic modification will remain a sensitive issue for Europe and the United States during trade talks.

headline.main: Modified Corn a Step Closer to Approval in Europe
headline.print_headline: Modified Corn a Step Closer to Approval in Europe
